name: get_vm
description: Retrieves the virtual machines on a vCenter Server system.

name.description: Coma-separated names of Virtual Machines to retrieve.

datastore.description: Coma-separated moId's of the Datastores accociated with searched VMs.

datastore_cluster.description: Coma-separated moId's of the Datastore Clusters accociated with searched VMs.

resource_pool.description: Coma-separated moId's of the vSphere ResourcePool objects, where VMs are going to be searched.

vapp.description: Coma-separated moId's of the vSphere VApp objects, where VMs are going to be searched.

host.description: Coma-separated moId's of the vSphere Host objects, where VMs are going to be searched.

folder.description: Coma-separated moId's of the vSphere folder objects, where VMs are going to be searched.

cluster.description: Coma-separated moId's of the vSphere compute cluster objects, where VMs are going to be searched.

datacenter.description: Coma-separated moId's of the vSphere datacenter objects, where VMs are going to be searched.

virtual_switch.description: Coma-separated moId's of the Virtual Switches, to which the searched VMs' network adapters are attached.

no_recursion.description: Specifies, whether or not to disable the recursive behavior or the command. By default it is False
